column4: I have a problem with my network in ubuntu. I've tried some forums but to no avail.
when I run "sudo /etc/init.d/networking restart" I get "send_packet: Network is unreachable
when I run "sudo /etc/init.d/networking restart" I get "send_packet: Network is unreachable" and also "SIOCSIFADDR: Permission denied". How can I daignose the problem?
did you get the output I sent?
oops didn't notice it one sec
ok you got two nics in that box...which one do you want to use?
the on-board one. I'm pretty sure it is eth0
when I say on board, I mean the SiS network card
umm..ok for me to figure out which is which, can you msg me the output of "grep -e "eth[0|1]" /var/log/messages"
eth0 is the SiS network card
is it easier for you to speak to me in a priv msg on do you want to talk on the channel?
